message.content:
{"id": "3622", 
 "title": "Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has a confusing message", 
 "description": "The New Package Wizard in the application displays a confusing message when the package name field is empty. The message says 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message appears at the top of the wizard before any input is entered. It is unclear what this message means and whether it indicates an error. Additionally, the message should be displayed in red with an error icon if it is indeed an error. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the New Java Package Wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Observe the message at the top of the wizard.

Expected Behavior:
The message should not be displayed when the package name field is empty, and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.

Notes:
- EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM): There should be no error message when the package name field is empty, and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.
- MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM): It is a warning. I will remove the message.
- EG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM): Issue: How to create a default package? It can't be created by the user since it is always there.", 
 "OB": "When the package name field is empty, the New Package Wizard should not display a message saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. Additionally, the 'Finish' button should be disabled in this scenario.", 
 "EB": "When the package name field is empty, the New Package Wizard incorrectly displays the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is confusing and should be removed or improved. Furthermore, the 'Finish' button should be disabled when the package name field is empty.", 
 "SR": "1. Remove the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' from the New Package Wizard when the package name field is empty.
2. Display the message in red with an error icon if it indicates an error.
3. Disable the 'Finish' button when the package name field is empty."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

{'id': '3622', 'title': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)', 'description': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: "A foldercorresponding to the package name already exists".At this point my package name fieldis empty.What does this message mean?Is this an error?If so, should it be displayed inred with the error icon?NOTES:EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM)there should be no error message when the package name field is empty andfinish should be disabled.MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM)It is a warning.I will remove the messageEG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM)issue how to create a default package?It can\'t be created by the user since it always there. ', 'SR': ''}
